hesmlclient

Class HESMLclient

  • java.lang.Object
    • hesmlclient.HESMLclient

  • public class HESMLclient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a basic client application of the HESML similarity measures library introduced in the paper below. Lastra-Díaz, J. J., and García-Serrano, A. (2016). HESML: a scalable ontology-based semantic similarity measures library with a set of reproducible experiments and a replication dataset. Submitted for publication in Information Systems Journal.
    Author:
    j.lastra

      • m_strBaseDir

        private static final java.lang.String m_strBaseDir
        WordNet database path, corpus-based Pedersen IC files, and results directory in the current PC. You should change the base HESML directory according to your code installation.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the main function where we show different use examples of HESML. The function processes an input XML file defining a set of reproducible experiments, or call a function implementing a set of examples in order to show the HESML functionality.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • SampleExperiments

        private static void SampleExperiments()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Each function call within this function is invoking some specific test example with the aim to show the HESML functionality.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testCorpusBasedSimilarityBenchmarks

        private static void testCorpusBasedSimilarityBenchmarks()
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This function runs the full collection of cross-validation tests for all the corpus-based IC models. The function runs the experiments on the five most significant similarity datasets. The function loads WordNet and creates a HESML taxonomy to represent it. The benchmarks loads the dataset files with the word pairs and creates a experiment matrix to evaluate each selected similarity measures and IC model.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testAllSimilarityBenchmarks

        private static void testAllSimilarityBenchmarks()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        This function runs the full collection of cross-validation tests for all the IC models and similarity measures, including the corpus-based and intrinsic IC models, as well as the non IC-based similarity measures. The function runs the experiments on the five most significant similarity datasets. The function loads WordNet and creates a HESML taxonomy to represent it. The benchmarks loads the dataset files with the word pairs and creates a experiment matrix to evaluate each selected similarity measures and IC model.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testMultipleICmodelsMultipleICmeasuresBenchmarks

        private static void testMultipleICmodelsMultipleICmeasuresBenchmarks()
                                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This function runs the tests for all the intrinsic IC models and IC-based similarity measures. The function runs the experiments on the five most significant similarity datasets. The function loads WordNet and creates a HESML taxonomy to represent it. The benchmarks loads the dataset files with the word pairs and creates a experiment matrix to evaluate each selected similarity measures and IC model.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testSingleICmodelMultipleICbasedMeasures

        private static void testSingleICmodelMultipleICbasedMeasures()
                                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This function evaluates a single intrinsic IC model with multiple IC-based similarity measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testSingleNonICbasedMeasure

        private static void testSingleNonICbasedMeasure()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        This function evaluates a single non IC-based similarity measure on a word similarity benchmark using an automatized benchmark object. You only need to load WordNet and select any benchmark. The benchmark computes the Pearson correlation value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testSingleICSimMeasureMultipleICmodels

        private static void testSingleICSimMeasureMultipleICmodels()
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This function corresponds to the cross-validation of a single IC-based similarity measure with multiple intrinsic IC models on a word similarity benchmark (dataset) using an automatized benchmark object. The benchmark computes the Pearson correlation values and save them into a csv file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testSingleICSimMeasureSingleICmodel

        private static void testSingleICSimMeasureSingleICmodel()
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This function corresponds to the cross-validation of a single IC-based similarity measure with multiple intrinsic IC models on a word similarity benchmark (dataset) using an automatized benchmark object. The benchmark computes the Pearson correlation values and save them into a csv file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testWordPairSimilarity

        private static void testWordPairSimilarity()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This function shows how to directly compute the similarity between words without any automatized benchmark. We show the use of two IC-based similarity model with an IC model, as well as the use of two non IC-based similarity measure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • buildWNSimRepFiles

        private static void buildWNSimRepFiles(java.lang.String strDatasetRootDir)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        This function builds all the data files in the WNSimRep v1 dataset, which is introduced in the following paper. Lastra-Díaz, J. J., and García-Serrano, A. (2016). WNSimRep: a framework and replication dataset for ontology-based semantic similarity measures and information content models. Mendeley Data v1. https://doi.org/10.17632/mpr2m8pycs.1
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • CopyWordsIntoTaxonomy

        private static void CopyWordsIntoTaxonomy(hesml.taxonomy.ITaxonomy taxonomy,
                                          hesml.taxonomyreaders.wordnet.IWordNetDB wordnet)
        This function copies the Synset words into the string tag field. It is used by the WNSimRep functions in order to export the words evocating each synset to the data files.
        Parameters:
        taxonomy - Taxonomy
        wordnet - WordNet database

      • CrossICmeasuresTest

        private static void CrossICmeasuresTest(java.lang.String strWordnetPrefix,
                                        hesml.taxonomy.ITaxonomy wordnetTaxonomy,
                                        hesml.taxonomyreaders.wordnet.IWordNetDB wordnet,
                                        java.lang.String strResultsDir,
                                        java.lang.String strWordnetDatasetsDir,
                                        java.lang.String strDataSetName)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This function evaluates a set of intrinsic IC models and IC-based similarity measures.
        Parameters:
        wordnetTaxonomy - Taxonomy
        wordnet - WordNet database
        strResultsDir - Out put directory
        strWordnetDatasetsDir - Input directory for the word similarity benchmarks
        strDataSetName - Dataset file name without the *.csv extension.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getIntrinsicICmodelsToEvaluate

        private static hesml.configurators.IntrinsicICModelType[] getIntrinsicICmodelsToEvaluate()
        This functions returns the sequence of intrinsic IC models that will be evaluated in the benchmarks.
        Returns:

      • getICbasedMeasuresToEvaluate

        private static hesml.measures.SimilarityMeasureType[] getICbasedMeasuresToEvaluate()
        This function returns the measure types to be evaluated into the IC-based benchmarks. You can set another measures according to the experiments that you need to carry-out.
        Returns:
        Vector of IC-based measure types.

      • getNonICmeasureTypesToEvaluate

        private static hesml.measures.SimilarityMeasureType[] getNonICmeasureTypesToEvaluate()
        This function returns the measure types to be evaluated into the non IC-based benchmarks. You can set another measures according to the experiments that you need to carry-out.
        Returns:
        Vector of IC-based measure types.

      • CrossNonICmeasures

        private static void CrossNonICmeasures(java.lang.String strWordnetPrefix,
                                       hesml.taxonomy.ITaxonomy wordnetTaxonomy,
                                       hesml.taxonomyreaders.wordnet.IWordNetDB wordnet,
                                       java.lang.String strResultsDir,
                                       java.lang.String strWordnetDatasetsDir,
                                       java.lang.String strDatasetName)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        This function runs a benchmark on a set of non IC-based measures
        Parameters:
        strWordnetPrefix - Prefix for the output file.
        wordnetTaxonomy - Base taxonomy for the similarity measures
        wordnet - WordNet database
        strResultsDir - Directory containing the output file
        strWordnetDatasetsDir - Directory containing the word similarity benchmarks
        strDatasetName - Name of the file containing the benchmark dataset
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createTestTaxonomy

        private static hesml.taxonomy.ITaxonomy createTestTaxonomy(int overallVertexes,
                                                           int maxChildren)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This function creates a tree-like taxonomy with the number of vertexes defined by the input parameter. For each vertex (node) of the tree, the function inserts a random number of children between two and maximal value. The seed of the generator of random numbers is always the same in order to warrant the reproducibility of the results.
        Parameters:
        overallVertexes - target size of the returned taxonomy
        Returns:
        A tree-like taxonomy with the number of vertexes required
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
